description: Establish a contract for a Global Positioning System (GPS) Solution, for a period of three (3) years, with the option to renew for up to two (2) additional one-year periods.
full_summary:
# Global Positioning System (GPS) Solution - Request for Proposal
## Announcement ID: PW-23-01020079
### Amendments: 3
#### Solicitation ID: SEN-051 22/23
### Publication and Tender Closing Dates

* Publication Date: January 4, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: February 8, 2023, 11:00 AM EST
### Technical Specifications and Scope

The Senate of Canada (Senate) invites qualified bidders to submit proposals for the provision of a Global Positioning System (GPS) Solution. The contract, with an initial term of three (3) years, includes an option to renew for up to two (2) additional one-year periods.

### Key Questions and Enquiries

To ensure clarity and consistency in information sharing among all bidders, all related questions and enquiries must be directed solely to the Contracting Authority by email at Proc-Appr@sen.parl.gc.ca. The deadline for submitting inquiries is January 16, 2023.

### Contracting Entity and Contact Information

The Senate of Canada
2 Rideau Street
Ottawa, ON K1A 0A4

Contact: AlEryani, Dina
dina.aleryani@sen.parl.gc.ca
613-995-8888 (ext 4)

### Procurement Details

* Competitive Procurement Method: Invitation to Open Tender
* Procurement Category: Goods and Services
* Trade Agreements: None
* Region of Opportunity: Canada
* Region of Delivery: Canada

### Additional Information

Attached documents can be viewed on the CanadaBuys website. A list of attached documents includes:

* dp_sen-051_2223_final_f_u_v02.pdf
* dp_sen-051_2223_question_et_reponse_1_f.pdf
* rfp_sen-051_2223_final_e_u.pdf
* rfp_sen-051_2223_amd3_e.pdf
* rfp_sen-051_2223_question_and_answer_1_e.pdf

Note that this contract has expired since it was first published. However, this does not apply to new information displayed here as of January 23, 2023, for which the deadline WILL still be considered active. However, a new call to action will likely be activated very soon after publication.
